title: Daniel Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Daniel chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Daniel Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Daniel Chapter 7.

questions.question: In the first year of whose reign did Daniel have his dream and visions?
options: Belshazzar king of Babylon
Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon
Cyrus king of Persia
Darius king of Persia
questions.correctAnswer: Belshazzar king of Babylon
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:1 states that the dream and visions happened in the first year of Belshazzar king of Babylon.

questions.question: What did Daniel see stirring upon the great sea in his vision?
options: Four winds of the heaven
Four rivers
Four mountains
Four stars
questions.correctAnswer: Four winds of the heaven
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:2 says that the four winds of the heaven strove upon the great sea in Daniel's vision.

questions.question: How many great beasts came up from the sea in Daniel's vision?
options: Four
Three
Five
Two
questions.correctAnswer: Four
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:3 clearly states that four great beasts came up from the sea.

questions.question: What was the first beast like in Daniel's vision?
options: A lion with eagle's wings
A bear with three ribs
A leopard with four wings
A dragon with seven heads
questions.correctAnswer: A lion with eagle's wings
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:4 describes the first beast as like a lion with eagle's wings.

questions.question: According to Daniel 7:5, how many ribs did the bear have in its mouth?
options: Three
Two
Four
One
questions.correctAnswer: Three
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:5 mentions that the bear had three ribs in its mouth between its teeth.

questions.question: What distinctive features did the leopard beast have according to Daniel's vision?
options: Four wings and four heads
Three heads and two wings
Two wings and one head
Five wings and three heads
questions.correctAnswer: Four wings and four heads
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:6 says the leopard had four wings of a fowl and four heads.

questions.question: What was unique about the fourth beast that Daniel saw?
options: It was dreadful, terrible, strong, and had ten horns
It was like a lamb with seven eyes
It had six wings and was covered in feathers
It was a giant eagle with one horn
questions.correctAnswer: It was dreadful, terrible, strong, and had ten horns
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:7 describes the fourth beast as dreadful, terrible, strong exceedingly, and having ten horns.

questions.question: What came up among the ten horns on the fourth beast?
options: Another little horn with eyes and a mouth speaking great things
A large winged horn
A fiery horn
A horn with seven eyes
questions.correctAnswer: Another little horn with eyes and a mouth speaking great things
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:8 says that a little horn came up among the ten horns, with eyes like a man and a mouth speaking great things.

questions.question: How is the Ancient of Days described in Daniel's vision?
options: Garment white as snow, hair like pure wool, throne like fiery flame
Clothed in purple, crowned with gold
Wearing a robe of many colors
Sitting on a cloud with lightning
questions.correctAnswer: Garment white as snow, hair like pure wool, throne like fiery flame
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:9 describes the Ancient of Days with a white garment, hair like pure wool, and a throne like fiery flame.

questions.question: What issued from before the Ancient of Days as he sat on his throne?
options: A fiery stream
A great wind
A river of water
A shining light
questions.correctAnswer: A fiery stream
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:10 states that a fiery stream issued and came forth from before the Ancient of Days.

questions.question: Who came with the clouds of heaven in Daniel's vision?
options: One like the Son of man
An angel of the Lord
The Ancient of Days
A mighty warrior
questions.correctAnswer: One like the Son of man
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:13 mentions one like the Son of man coming with the clouds of heaven.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel was comforted and joyful after seeing the visions of his head.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:15 states that Daniel was grieved in his spirit and troubled by the visions of his head.

questions.question: True or False: The four great beasts in Daniel's vision represent four kings that shall arise out of the earth.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:17 explains that the four great beasts are four kings which shall arise out of the earth.

questions.question: True or False: According to Daniel, the saints of the most High will never possess the kingdom.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:18 states that the saints of the most High shall take and possess the kingdom forever.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'The fourth beast shall be the fourth ______ upon earth, which shall be diverse from all kingdoms.'
options: kingdom
king
prophecy
angel
questions.correctAnswer: kingdom
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:23 says 'The fourth beast shall be the fourth kingdom upon earth.'

medium.title: Daniel Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Daniel Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Daniel 7, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God's ultimate kingdom?
options: God's kingdom is everlasting and will not be destroyed
Earthly kingdoms are eternal and unchanging
We must rely solely on our own strength in trials
Judgment and reward are delayed indefinitely
questions.correctAnswer: God's kingdom is everlasting and will not be destroyed
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:14 and 7:27 teach that the kingdom given to the Son of Man is everlasting and shall not be destroyed, reassuring believers to trust God's eternal dominion amid trials.

questions.question: How does Daniel 7 encourage believers to persevere through spiritual battles and opposition?
options: The saints will ultimately possess the kingdom after judgment
Believers should avoid conflict at all costs
Opposition means God has abandoned His people
Victory is guaranteed by human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: The saints will ultimately possess the kingdom after judgment
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:21-22 and 7:18 assure that although the horn makes war against the saints, judgment is given to them and they will possess the kingdom forever, encouraging perseverance through opposition.

questions.question: A believer struggles with fear about the future amid uncertain times. According to Daniel 7, what should they remember about God's sovereignty?
options: The Ancient of Days sits in judgment with authority and power
The beasts represent God's abandonment of the earth
Human empires are stronger than God's kingdom
The future is entirely unpredictable and uncontrolled
questions.correctAnswer: The Ancient of Days sits in judgment with authority and power
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:9-10 depicts the Ancient of Days seated on a fiery throne with judgment set, showing God's sovereign control over time and history, offering peace in uncertainty.

questions.question: How does Daniel 7 illustrate the importance of humility and contentment in the face of worldly powers?
options: The great beasts and horns symbolize earthly kingdoms that will pass away
Pride in human kingdoms is encouraged as a sign of strength
Contentment comes from accumulating power and wealth
Worldly kingdoms are permanent and to be trusted
questions.correctAnswer: The great beasts and horns symbolize earthly kingdoms that will pass away
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:3-7 and 7:23-24 show that earthly kingdoms are temporary and diverse, reminding believers to remain humble and content, trusting God's eternal kingdom instead.

questions.question: In Daniel 7, what spiritual discipline can believers practice when troubled by visions or circumstances, as Daniel himself was?
options: Seeking understanding through prayer and asking for interpretation
Ignoring troubling thoughts and visions
Reacting with fear and despair
Relying on human wisdom without seeking God's guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Seeking understanding through prayer and asking for interpretation
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:15-16 shows Daniel troubled in spirit, and he approaches one standing by to learn the truth, illustrating the value of seeking God’s wisdom in prayer and reflection.

questions.question: How does Daniel 7 teach us about the work ethic and honesty in daily life through the example of divine judgment?
options: God’s judgment will ultimately reward integrity and justice
Dishonesty and injustice go unpunished in the kingdom of God
Human deeds have no impact on the final judgment
Only outward appearances matter to God
questions.correctAnswer: God’s judgment will ultimately reward integrity and justice
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:10 and 7:26 describe judgment where books are opened and dominion is taken away from the wicked, highlighting that God values honesty and justice in daily life.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with bitterness toward those who oppose their faith. Based on Daniel 7, what biblical truth about forgiveness and trust can you share?
options: God will judge the oppressors and give the kingdom to His saints
Believers must take revenge immediately
Forgiveness means ignoring injustice without hope
Opposition is a sign that God has rejected His people
questions.correctAnswer: God will judge the oppressors and give the kingdom to His saints
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:21-22 and 7:26-27 reveal that despite opposition, God judges the wicked and grants the kingdom to the saints, encouraging believers to entrust vengeance to God and forgive.

questions.question: How can Daniel 7 encourage believers to be faithful witnesses in the midst of trials and hostile environments?
options: The saints will ultimately receive eternal dominion and glory
Faithfulness is futile when facing powerful enemies
Believers must avoid witnessing to stay safe
Trials mean God has abandoned His people
questions.correctAnswer: The saints will ultimately receive eternal dominion and glory
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:18 and 7:27 assure that the saints will inherit an everlasting kingdom, motivating believers to remain faithful witnesses even amid hardship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Daniel 7, the 'little horn' that speaks great things symbolizes a humble and powerless figure.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:8 and 7:20 describe the little horn as having eyes like a man and a mouth speaking great things, being proud and powerful rather than humble and powerless.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel 7 teaches that believers should be troubled and anxious about visions, keeping them to themselves without seeking understanding.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:15-16 shows Daniel was troubled but sought understanding by asking one standing by, teaching believers to seek clarity through prayer and counsel rather than remain anxious alone.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Daniel saw four great beasts come up from the ____.
options: sea
earth
sky
desert
questions.correctAnswer: sea
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:3 states that four great beasts came up from the sea, symbolizing kingdoms arising from chaotic realms.

questions.question: How does Daniel 7 teach us about humility and the dangers of pride in leadership?
options: The proud little horn is eventually judged and his dominion taken away
Pride in leadership ensures lasting success
Leaders should speak great things to gain power
Powerful leaders are never held accountable
questions.correctAnswer: The proud little horn is eventually judged and his dominion taken away
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:8, 7:25-26 describe the little horn's arrogance and eventual judgment, teaching humility and warning against prideful leadership.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because of injustice in the world. Based on Daniel 7, what hope can you offer about God's justice?
options: God’s judgment will consume and destroy wicked dominion
Injustice will last forever without consequence
God ignores earthly affairs
Only human courts bring true justice
questions.correctAnswer: God’s judgment will consume and destroy wicked dominion
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:26 explains that judgment will sit and the wicked dominion will be consumed and destroyed, offering hope for ultimate divine justice.

questions.question: How does Daniel 7 show the importance of prayer and seeking God's wisdom in understanding spiritual matters?
options: Daniel asked for interpretation to understand his troubling vision
Believers should accept visions without seeking clarity
Spiritual matters should be ignored as confusing
Only scholars can understand spiritual visions
questions.correctAnswer: Daniel asked for interpretation to understand his troubling vision
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:16 reveals Daniel seeking explanation from a heavenly figure, encouraging believers to pray and seek God’s wisdom when facing spiritual confusion.

questions.question: How can Daniel 7 guide believers in maintaining integrity and faithfulness in a corrupt world?
options: The saints will receive an everlasting kingdom despite worldly corruption
Corruption is to be embraced as inevitable
Integrity leads to earthly riches and power
Faithfulness is only for personal benefit
questions.correctAnswer: The saints will receive an everlasting kingdom despite worldly corruption
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:18 and 7:27 affirm that saints will possess an everlasting kingdom, encouraging faithfulness and integrity regardless of worldly corruption.

hard.title: Daniel Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Daniel Chapter 7.

questions.question: What is the significance of the four beasts coming up from the sea in Daniel's vision?
options: They represent four kings that shall arise out of the earth
They symbolize four angels watching over the nations
They depict four seasons of the year
They are four rivers flowing from Eden
questions.correctAnswer: They represent four kings that shall arise out of the earth
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:17 explicitly states that the four great beasts are four kings that shall arise out of the earth, symbolizing kingdoms or empires.

questions.question: Which beast in Daniel's vision is described as having eagle's wings that were plucked off, and then made to stand like a man?
options: The first beast, like a lion
The second beast, like a bear
The third beast, like a leopard
The fourth beast, dreadful and strong
questions.correctAnswer: The first beast, like a lion
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:4 describes the first beast as like a lion with eagle's wings that were plucked off, and it was lifted up and stood on feet like a man.

questions.question: What do the ten horns on the fourth beast symbolize according to Daniel's interpretation?
options: Ten kings that shall arise
Ten tribes of Israel
Ten angels of judgment
Ten plagues on Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Ten kings that shall arise
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:24 clarifies that the ten horns on the fourth beast represent ten kings who will arise from that kingdom.

questions.question: In Daniel's vision, who is described as having eyes like the eyes of man and a mouth speaking great things?
options: The little horn among the ten horns
The Ancient of Days
The Son of Man
The first beast
questions.correctAnswer: The little horn among the ten horns
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:8 describes a little horn coming up among the ten horns, having eyes like a man and a mouth speaking great things.

questions.question: What is the description of the Ancient of Days' appearance in Daniel's vision?
options: Garment white as snow, hair like pure wool, throne like fiery flame
Clothed in sackcloth, eyes like fire, throne of gold
Robed in purple, crowned with stars, throne of ice
Dressed in black, surrounded by darkness, throne of stone
questions.correctAnswer: Garment white as snow, hair like pure wool, throne like fiery flame
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:9 describes the Ancient of Days with garments white as snow, hair like pure wool, and a throne like fiery flame with wheels as burning fire.

questions.question: How does Daniel describe the judgment scene involving the Ancient of Days and the beasts?
options: The beast was slain, body destroyed and given to the burning flame
The beasts were crowned and given dominion over the earth
The beasts were transformed into angels
The beasts fled and hid from the Ancient of Days
questions.correctAnswer: The beast was slain, body destroyed and given to the burning flame
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:11 explains that because of the great words spoken by the horn, the beast was slain, destroyed, and given to the burning flame.

questions.question: Who is the figure described as 'one like the Son of man' in Daniel's vision, and what is his role?
options: A heavenly figure given everlasting dominion and glory
A king of Babylon who conquers the earth
An angel who commands the ten horns
A prophet who interprets the dream
questions.correctAnswer: A heavenly figure given everlasting dominion and glory
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:13-14 describes one like the Son of man coming with the clouds of heaven who is given dominion, glory, and an everlasting kingdom.

questions.question: What is the ultimate fate of the kingdom ruled by the little horn that speaks great words against the Most High?
options: Its dominion will be taken away to be consumed and destroyed
It will reign forever with the saints
It will be divided into ten smaller kingdoms
It will be transformed into a peaceful kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Its dominion will be taken away to be consumed and destroyed
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:26 states that judgment will sit and his dominion will be taken away to be consumed and destroyed until the end.

questions.question: According to Daniel 7, how long will the saints of the Most High possess the kingdom?
options: Forever and ever
For a thousand years
Until the beasts rise again
For seventy weeks
questions.correctAnswer: Forever and ever
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:18 and 7:27 both affirm that the saints of the Most High shall possess the kingdom forever and ever, an everlasting kingdom.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Daniel 7 with the description of beasts representing kingdoms?
options: Typology and symbolism
Parable and allegory
Chiasm and acrostic
Hyperbole and metaphor
questions.correctAnswer: Typology and symbolism
questions.explanation: The beasts symbolize kingdoms and kings, a typological and symbolic literary device common in apocalyptic literature such as Daniel 7.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophetic book also contains visions of beasts symbolizing kingdoms that parallel Daniel's vision?
options: Ezekiel
Isaiah
Jeremiah
Zechariah
questions.correctAnswer: Ezekiel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel chapters 1 and 37 contain symbolic visions of creatures and kingdoms that parallel the apocalyptic imagery in Daniel 7.

questions.question: The phrase 'time, times and the dividing of time' in Daniel 7:25 is best understood as referring to what?
options: A prophetic period of persecution
A literal three-year reign
The four seasons of the year
The division of the Hebrew calendar
questions.correctAnswer: A prophetic period of persecution
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:25 uses the phrase to describe the duration the little horn will oppress the saints, a symbolic prophetic time period.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel was comforted and at peace after receiving the vision and interpretation in Daniel 7.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:15 and 7:28 reveal that Daniel was troubled and grieved in his spirit, and his countenance changed as he kept the matter in his heart.

questions.question: What role do the 'thousand thousands' and 'ten thousand times ten thousand' have in the judgment scene in Daniel 7?
options: They minister and stand before the Ancient of Days during judgment
They are fallen angels awaiting punishment
They are the ten tribes of Israel in assembly
They represent the armies of the fourth beast
questions.correctAnswer: They minister and stand before the Ancient of Days during judgment
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:10 describes these multitudes as ministering to the Ancient of Days and standing before him at the judgment.

questions.question: How does Daniel 7 foreshadow the New Testament understanding of Jesus Christ as the 'Son of Man'?
options: By describing a heavenly figure given eternal dominion and glory
By predicting the exact date of His earthly ministry
By naming Him as the Messiah who will reign over Israel only
By describing Him as a beast conquering kingdoms
questions.correctAnswer: By describing a heavenly figure given eternal dominion and glory
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:13-14's depiction of 'one like the Son of man' who receives everlasting dominion is a key Old Testament foreshadowing of Jesus Christ's Messianic role as affirmed in the New Testament.

theological.title: Daniel Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Daniel Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In Daniel's vision, what do the four great beasts coming up from the sea represent?
options: Four kings that shall arise out of the earth
Four angels ministering to God
Four nations destroyed by God
Four seasons of the year
questions.correctAnswer: Four kings that shall arise out of the earth
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:17 explicitly states that the four great beasts are four kings arising from the earth, symbolizing earthly kingdoms. This typology aligns with other Old Testament prophetic imagery of kingdoms as beasts (e.g., Revelation 13:1; Jeremiah 4:7; Ezekiel 32:2; Psalm 74:13-14).

questions.question: What attribute is given to the first beast, described like a lion with eagle's wings, after its wings were plucked?
options: It was made to stand like a man and given a man's heart
It was destroyed by fire
It was given dominion over all the earth
It was cast into the sea
questions.correctAnswer: It was made to stand like a man and given a man's heart
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:4 describes the first beast's wings being plucked and it standing like a man with a man's heart. This symbolizes a transformation from wild animalistic power to human-like qualities, possibly indicative of a kingdom becoming more human or civil. This theme of transformation and dominion is echoed in prophetic literature (Ezekiel 1:10; Revelation 13:2; Isaiah 11:6; Psalm 34:10).

questions.question: Which characteristic is NOT associated with the fourth beast in Daniel’s vision?
options: Ten horns
Teeth of iron
Wings of a fowl
Dreadful and terrible
questions.correctAnswer: Wings of a fowl
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:7 describes the fourth beast as dreadful, terrible, strong with iron teeth, and having ten horns, but it does not have wings of a fowl; that characteristic belongs to the third beast (Daniel 7:6). The fourth beast represents a uniquely powerful and destructive kingdom (Revelation 13:2; Ezekiel 38:4; Psalm 2:9; Daniel 2:40).

questions.question: What do the ten horns on the fourth beast symbolize?
options: Ten kings that shall arise
Ten angels of God
Ten tribes of Israel
Ten commandments
questions.correctAnswer: Ten kings that shall arise
questions.explanation: According to Daniel 7:24, the ten horns represent ten kings arising from the fourth kingdom. This symbolism is consistent with prophetic imagery elsewhere, where horns often represent kings or powers (Revelation 17:12; Psalm 18:2; Zechariah 1:18; 1 Samuel 2:10).

questions.question: Who is described as having eyes like a man and a mouth speaking great things among the horns?
options: The little horn
The Ancient of days
The Son of man
The first beast
questions.correctAnswer: The little horn
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:8 and 7:20 describe a little horn arising among the ten horns, with eyes like a man and a mouth speaking great things. This figure symbolizes a powerful, boastful ruler opposing God and His saints, reflecting themes of arrogance and blasphemy (2 Thessalonians 2:3-4; Revelation 13:5-6; Psalm 12:4; Isaiah 14:13-14).

questions.question: What is the significance of the Ancient of days in Daniel’s vision?
options: He represents God’s eternal and sovereign judgment
He is a human king
He is a prophet interpreting dreams
He is one of the beasts
questions.correctAnswer: He represents God’s eternal and sovereign judgment
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:9-10 depicts the Ancient of days as a divine figure with white garments and flaming throne, symbolizing God’s eternal nature and authority to execute judgment. This aligns with biblical teachings on God’s sovereignty and justice (Psalm 90:2; Revelation 1:14; Hebrews 12:29; Isaiah 40:28).

questions.question: According to Daniel 7, what happens to the fourth beast and the little horn that speaks great things?
options: They are slain and their dominion is taken away
They conquer all the earth
They ascend to heaven
They form an everlasting kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: They are slain and their dominion is taken away
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:11 and 7:26 describe the beast being slain and its body destroyed by fire, and the dominion of the little horn being taken away to be consumed and destroyed. This demonstrates God’s ultimate victory over evil and injustice (Revelation 19:20; Psalm 37:10; Isaiah 25:8; 2 Thessalonians 1:7-9).

questions.question: What is the eternal nature of the kingdom given to the 'one like the Son of man'?
options: His dominion is everlasting and shall not be destroyed
His kingdom lasts for a limited time
His dominion passes away with the beasts
His kingdom is earthly and temporary
questions.correctAnswer: His dominion is everlasting and shall not be destroyed
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:14 and 7:27 emphasize the everlasting dominion and indestructible kingdom given to the Son of man, reflecting the messianic promise of eternal rule. This truth is echoed in the New Testament regarding Christ’s eternal reign (Luke 1:33; Revelation 11:15; Isaiah 9:7; Hebrews 1:8).

questions.question: How do the saints of the Most High relate to the kingdom in Daniel’s vision?
options: They shall possess the kingdom forever
They are destroyed by the beasts
They are separate from the kingdom
They rule the beasts
questions.correctAnswer: They shall possess the kingdom forever
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:18 and 7:22 teach that the saints of the Most High will take and possess the kingdom forever, signifying God’s people’s ultimate victory and eternal inheritance. This corresponds to New Testament teachings on the saints reigning with Christ (Revelation 20:4-6; 2 Timothy 2:12; Romans 8:17; Matthew 25:34).

questions.question: What does the phrase 'a time, times, and the dividing of time' refer to in Daniel 7?
options: A prophetic period of persecution for the saints
A literal three-year period
The lifetime of Daniel
The duration of the four beasts
questions.correctAnswer: A prophetic period of persecution for the saints
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:25 mentions this phrase in connection with the little horn persecuting the saints, representing a symbolic duration of trial and suffering. This concept is widely interpreted as a prophetic time of tribulation (Revelation 12:14; Daniel 12:7; Mark 13:14; 2 Thessalonians 2:3).

questions.question: What does Daniel do after seeing the troubling visions in chapter 7?
options: He seeks understanding by asking one who stood by
He immediately interprets the dream himself
He ignores the vision
He destroys the written dream
questions.correctAnswer: He seeks understanding by asking one who stood by
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:15-16 shows Daniel troubled by the visions, prompting him to seek interpretation from a nearby figure. This demonstrates the human need for divine revelation and guidance in understanding prophetic mysteries (Proverbs 2:3-6; Job 33:33; Acts 10:19-20; 1 Corinthians 2:14).

questions.question: What is the role of the 'books' mentioned in Daniel 7:10 in the judgment scene?
options: They contain records used for judgment
They are books of magic
They list the names of kings only
They are symbolic scrolls of the beasts
questions.correctAnswer: They contain records used for judgment
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:10 refers to books being opened as the judgment is set, indicating a divine record-keeping function essential for righteous judgment. This motif appears in other scriptures concerning the final judgment (Revelation 20:12; Malachi 3:16; Exodus 32:32; Psalm 56:8).

questions.question: How is the Son of man depicted coming to the Ancient of days in Daniel 7?
options: Coming with the clouds of heaven
Riding a horse
As a lion with eagle's wings
In the form of a bear
questions.correctAnswer: Coming with the clouds of heaven
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:13 describes the Son of man coming with the clouds of heaven, an image denoting divine authority and messianic glory. This symbolism is affirmed in the New Testament regarding Christ’s return (Matthew 24:30; Mark 14:62; Revelation 1:7; Psalm 104:3).

questions.question: What is the ultimate destiny of the kingdom and dominion according to Daniel 7:27?
options: Given to the people of the saints of the Most High
Destroyed by the beasts
Given to the little horn
Divided among the ten kings
questions.correctAnswer: Given to the people of the saints of the Most High
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:27 reveals that the everlasting kingdom will be given to God's people, the saints of the Most High, who will serve and obey Him. This reflects the eschatological hope of the faithful inheriting God's kingdom (1 Corinthians 15:24-25; Revelation 21:3-4; Romans 8:17; Matthew 25:34).

questions.question: What does Daniel confess about his reaction to the visions in Daniel 7:28?
options: He was greatly troubled and his countenance changed
He rejoiced and praised God
He immediately understood the visions
He shared the visions publicly
questions.correctAnswer: He was greatly troubled and his countenance changed
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:28 records Daniel's deep distress and changed appearance due to the troubling nature of the visions, demonstrating the human response to divine revelation of judgment and eschatological realities (Jeremiah 20:9; Ezekiel 3:14; Habakkuk 3:16; Luke 24:17).
